text: Boops boops, the bogue, is a species of ray-finned fish. Its common name in most languages refers to its large bug eyes. == Description == Little is known about Boops boops, but it resembles a mackerel. == Distribution == The species is found off the coasts of Europe, Africa, the Azores and the Canary Islands, from Norway to Angola, and in the Mediterranean and Black Seas. It avoids brackish waters such as the Baltic Sea. == Related pages == * Aeoliscoides * Eigengrau == References == ==Other websites== * Photos of Boops boops on Sealife Collection Category:Perciformes Category:IUCN Red List least concern species
title: Boops boops
